description: The Customer Service Centre & Library is a very modern civic, whilst being a natural fit with the neighbouring Edwardian buildings that front the busy Barking Road.

factsheet.heading: Building Aims
paragraphs: This building reinvigorates the town centre of East Ham by London Borough of Newhamsâ€™ decision to return its core team back to its home after years of relocations elsewhere in the borough. The siting of the CSC+L was carefully considered as the catalyst for a host of new routes and interlinked public spaces across the campus. The building knits together the wider site by emphasising the relationship between the Civic Campus and Town Centre.

factsheet.heading: Architectural Details
paragraphs: A deceptively simple square plan typology drawing on the immediate context is then sculpted notionally to involve aspects of its surroundings: establishing an exchange or connection between elements. The plan form in turn, responds to existing trees, adjacent streets, building lines, and vistas, and takes a particular interest in the way facades turn corners and windows framing key views.

Large floor plates with clear sightlines are punctuated by a central void that shifts upwards, with spectacular views of the sky through a top-lit roof light. Full height windows to maximise the natural light deep into the plan, and maintaining strong visual connections to the surrounding context are key aspects of the design.

name: East Ham Customer Service Centre and Library
